title: New Year Fireworks and Parties in the UK
summary: People in the UK celebrated the new year with big fireworks and parties. In London, 12,000 fireworks lit up the sky near the Thames River, and 100,000 people watched. Edinburgh Castle had a six-minute firework show with thousands of people at a street party called Hogmanay. The weather was cold with snow and ice warnings in some places. Music from famous singers played during the displays, and events honored sports wins and shows. The London Mayor said the celebrations showed how important it is to be together. Other cities like Belfast and Cardiff also had parties. Edinburgh's party was special because last year's event was canceled due to bad weather, so they used some old fireworks this time. Families, like one with a seven-year-old boy, enjoyed the fun.

background_read: New Year's Eve is a time when people around the world celebrate the start of a new year. In the UK, cities like London and Edinburgh have big parties with fireworks, music, and street events. Fireworks are colorful explosions in the sky that make celebrations exciting. Hogmanay is a traditional Scottish celebration for New Year's Eve with dancing and singing. Weather warnings help people stay safe when it's very cold or snowy. Celebrations often include music from popular artists and honor special events from the past year.
